edu.cscc.javaadventure.engine.combat

Interface Combatant

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Combatant>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CharacterCombatant

    public interface Combatant
extends java.lang.Comparable<Combatant>
    This interface is used in combat situations in order to hide the underlying implementations of the combatants. It allows JavaAdventure the flexibility to have many different kinds of combatants.

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        java.lang.String attack(int roll,
                        Combatant combatant)
                 throws OpponentIncapacitatedException,
                        InvalidRollException
        Attack another combatant. Success and damage of the attack is based on the implementation of the interface.
        Parameters:
        roll - Represents a die roll which determines if the attack was successful or not.
        combatant - The target combatant to be attacked.
        Returns:
        A description of the attack.
        Throws:
        OpponentIncapacitatedException - When the opponent is already incapacitated and cannot fight anymore.
        InvalidRollException - When the die roll is invalid or out of the allowed bounds.

      • calculateInitiative

        void calculateInitiative(int roll)
                  throws InvalidRollException
        Initiative represents the order in which combatants can act in a turn-based game. A lower initiative is better, meaning the combatant can act before other combatants can act.
        Parameters:
        roll - The roll value used when determining initiative.
        Throws:
        InvalidRollException - When the die roll is invalid or out of the allowed bounds.

      • equipWeapon

        void equipWeapon(Weapon weapon)
          throws UnableToWieldWeaponException
        Allows a combatant to equip a weapon for increased damage or other effects.
        Parameters:
        weapon - The Weapon to be equipped.
        Throws:
        UnableToWieldWeaponException - When the combatant cannot equip the weapon for various reasons.

      • getWeapon

        Weapon getWeapon()
        Gets the Weapon the combatant is currently equipped with.
        Returns:
        The weapon.

      • getInitiative

        int getInitiative()
        Gets the current initiative of the combatant. See calculateInitiative(int)
        Returns:
        The initiative value.

      • getArmorClass

        java.lang.Integer getArmorClass()
        Armor class represents the combatant's ability to defend themselves. Generally a higher armor class is better.
        Returns:
        The current armor class of the Combatant.

      • getHealth

        java.lang.Integer getHealth()
        Get the combatant's current health.
        Returns:
        The combatant's current health.

      • receiveDamage

        void receiveDamage(int damage)
        Allows the combatant to take damage, which reduces their health.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage.

      • isActiveCombatant

        boolean isActiveCombatant()
        Indicates if the combatant can still fight or not. Generally this is based on the combatant's health, but could be implemented differently for different reasons.
        Returns:
        true if the combatant can still fight, false otherwise.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the combatant.
        Returns:
        The name of the combatant.
